fields.title: About
fields.content:
Akorn

Welcome! Akorn brings you all the latest research, in a nutshell. Akorn is a new website for academia, aiming to make the lives of researchers simpler, more networked, more powerful, and more open. Akorn will give you a personalizable news stream of all new papers in your field, vastly simplifying the task of keeping up to date with the literature. Akorn will also give you an ecosystem of research apps, taking locally developed research tools and spreading them to the wider community. You'll find tools for downloading tables of data, detecting chemicals mentioned in articles, visualizing citation networks, and much more.

Until we launch in early 2013, subscribe to our blog and twitter stream! Or, if you're a web developer, then join our team. We will be posting updates of the site's progress as we prepare to launch. In addition, we regularly post articles and links about innovations in academic collaboration, open access, the modernisation of publishing, data sharing, and new online research tools. We support any initiatives that aim to make these future visions of research a very present possibility. See you again soon!

fields.title: Recruitment
fields.content:
Recruiting!

Web Developers // Web Designers

for open science web project

We are an Oxford-based project creating an ambitious and cutting-edge website for scientific research. We are expanding the project as we get ready to launch in beta. If you have experience with web development or design, or mobile app development - we want to hear from you!

Details

Akorn offers users a news feed to watch the latest research, as well as a platform for exchanging research apps. See the about page for more details. We are supportive of the open access / open science movement, and aim to encourage open innovation in a research context. We are looking for web developers to help build the core of the site, and graphic/web designers to help build a great UI. More details on positions below…

Contact

If this sounds interesting, then get in touch! Email us some brief info about yourself:

recruitment@akorn.org

Note that the project is not yet funded but we are seeking funding. Our team currently works for free, so this may suit those wishing to gain CV experience or simply wanting to be part of an ambitious and lively project.
